definition[0]: a statement that is not strong enough to express how good, bad, impressive etc something really is
example[0]: To say the movie was bad is an understatement.
example[1]: ‘It wasn’t very easy to find the house.’ ‘That’s got to be the understatement of the year!’
definition[1]: the practice of making something seem to have less of a particular quality than it really has
example[2]: ‘We have not done quite well enough, ’ Macmillan said, with characteristic understatement.
